column3: card_rule
column4: CONCATENATE("insert into trainer_cards (",TEXTJOIN(",",TRUE,A$1,C$1),") values('",TEXTJOIN("','",FALSE,A2,C2),"');")

column3: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts a a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can''t retreat, and can''t be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn''t count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-70','Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts a a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can''t retreat, and can''t be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn''t count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.');

column3: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-71','Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.');

column3: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokémon. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-72','Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokémon. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).');

column3: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-73','Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.');

column3: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-74','Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.');

column3: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-75','You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.');

column3: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-76','Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.');

column3: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-77','Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.');

column3: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-78','Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)');

column3: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent''s Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-79','Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent''s Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.');

column3: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent''s next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-80','Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent''s next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).');

column3: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base1-81','Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.');

column3: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

column3: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon''s attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

column3: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon card from your opponent''s discard pile and put it onto his or her Bench. (You can''t play Pokémon Flute if your opponent''s Bench is full.)

column3: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

column3: Put 1 Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile onto your Bench. Put damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can''t play Revive if your Bench is full.)

column3: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can''t do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('base5-74','Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.');

column3: Flip a coin. If tails, do 10 damage to your Active Pokémon. If heads, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, your opponent does 10 damage to his or her Active Pokémon. If heads, you flip a coin. Keep doing this until a player gets tails.

Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn''t a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('gym2-107','Put 1 card from your hand face down onto your Bench. (You can''t play this card if your Bench is full.) Treat that card as a Basic Pokémon as long as it''s face down. Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn''t a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.');

column3: Your opponent reveals his or her hand., Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Then, draw that many cards., You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

column3: You may play 2 Puzzle of Time cards at once. • If you played 1 card, look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order. • If you played 2 cards, put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand., You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
column4: insert into trainer_cards (id,card_rule) values('xy9-109','You may play 2 Puzzle of Time cards at once. • If you played 1 card, look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order. • If you played 2 cards, put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand., You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).');

column3: Choose which way this card faces before you play it. Any damage done to this ↓ player''s Metal Pokémon by an opponent''s attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance)., Choose which way this card faces before you play it. The attacks of this ↓ player''s Darkness Pokémon do 10 more damage to your opponent''s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance)., This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can''t play this card.
